com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.server.tasks
Class MatchmakerTask

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.server.tasks.MatchmakerTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.sun.sgs.app.Task, Serializable
public class MatchmakerTask
extends Object
implements com.sun.sgs.app.Task, Serializable

This task is a self re-scheduling task that polls the front of the login deques and uses the players to start a new game. During each execution of the task, each individual deque will be polled at most once. The polled players will be added to a local list of waiting players. If the local list fills up, a game will be started, the local list will be emptied, and the matchmaker will be rescheduled. If local list does not fill up, the task is rescheduled to fill it.

Author:
Owen Kellett

Constructs a MatchmakerTask with the given attributes and components.

Parameters:
numPlayersPerGame - number of human players to include in a game
numRobotsPerGame - number of server controlled robots per game
robotDelay - configured delay between robot actions
gameFactory - factory to create game objects
entityFactory - factory to create in-game artifacts
waitingDeques - array of queues which contain connecting clients
